data.description:
Ordinary Objects for Quest allows you to play flows made with the OO editor. 

Our goal is to enable playful prototyping and fast iteration speeds for spatial experiences.

We provide you with the essential tools to discover the most innovative use-cases and most delightful user experiences.

changelog.change_log:
Updates:  Quest v0.1.26 (120) and windows/macOS 0.1.5 (49)

Today's update includes an exciting new feature: the States Board! 
The States Board shows all States and connections currently active in your flow. Simply zoom out of a State and switch to the board. Or zoom into a the State thumbnail and switch back. It's a fast and easy way to keep track of your story line and flow. 

New Features and updates 
- Major under-the-hood upgrades to support the next wave of incredible tools! 
- Fixed an issue where identical names of objects and triggers would cause the misrepresentation of a state 
- Fixed: On Click simulations leading to non-existing states 
- Fixed: Animations don't properly reset - Fixed: On Click on animated GLBs.

New Features and updates
- We added workspace managment, you can now add several workspaces to your team, rename and delete them!
- You can move project between workspaces.
- We added a new occluder material to make portals.
- Ability to show thumbails in templates.
- Automatic login after app startup got improved.
- Fixed an issue where undoing too fast could lead to synchronisation issues.
- Fixed an issue so that baked GLB animations reset and replay correctly when using Rollback or changing states

Always make sure to keep your Editor and Companion up to date to access new features.

- Experimental: live updates between Editor and Companions, collaborate across devices in real-time! 

- You can now add audio files as custom assets and play them with the Play Audio action. 

- Environment objects can now be coloured with the standard material to make a higher contrast to your design or fit your brand presentation. 

- The Editor now handles when the connection to the internet gets lost and reconnects automatically. 

- It is now possible to duplicate a State from the left panel header to make the design process even faster 

- Companions now feature the team selection in the settings to filter the projects of a specific team. 

- The Editor and Companions keep your selected team across sessions. 

- We fixed an issue of disappearing project thumbnails.

Always make sure to keep your editor and companion up to date to access new features.

New Features and updates:
- Experimental: Playback of baked animation in GLB assets is now enabled through the new Play Animation action.
- On Quest and iOS, real-time updates to the flow library are currently disabled to avoid frequent auto-logouts.
- You can now set colors more conveniently with the Color picker.
- It's now possible to recenter the viewport on a selected object by pressing the F key.
- Pointing with the Head into the scene is now slightly adjusted to feel more natural.
- We fixed a bug that would cause the editor to freeze when copy and past Anchors between States.

This is the first release of Ordinary Objects for Quest 3.
The Ordinary Objects for Quest allows to play flows designed in the our Editor.

Available Behaviours:
- On Start
- On Click
- Proximity
- While Proximity
- Long Hover
- While Hover
- Auto Transform
- Look At
- Shake
- Pop
- Spin

Available Anchors:
- Surface Anchor
- Spatial Anchor
